sen.j: 用人（ようにん）は、江戸時代の武家の職制のひとつ。
sen.e: Yonin (steward) was a member of the organization that formed part of a samurai family during the Edo period.

sen.j: 封建制の用向きを家中に伝達して、庶務を司ることを主たる役目とした。
sen.e: The Yonin (steward) handled feudal related matters on behalf of the whole samurai family and, was the key figure responsible for administering a broad range of matters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Yonin (steward) handled feudal related matters on behalf of the whole samurai family and, was the key figure responsible for administering a broad range of matters.

sen.e: The Yonin handled feudal related matters on behalf of the whole samurai family and, was the key figure responsible for administering a broad range of matters.
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 有能な者から選ばれることが多かった。
sen.e: As such,it was common to select a capable individual for the role of Yonin (steward).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As such,it was common to select a capable individual for the role of Yonin (steward).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 御用人（ごようにん）とも。
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It is also known as Goyonin.
sen.cmt: 訳出しました。

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 用人には、側用人・公用人・広敷用人と呼ばれる用人が知られている。
sen.e: Yonin (stewards) were also known to be called `Soba-Yonin` (adjutant steward), `Ko-Yonin` (assistants of Daimyo (feudal lords) and Komyo (minor feudal lords), 'Hiroshiki-Yojin) (Daimyo`s wife`s steward or, key steward in a merchant household).

sen.e: Yonin were also known to be called Soba-Yonin (adjutant steward), Ko-Yonin (assistants of Daimyo (feudal lords) and Komyo (minor feudal lords)), Hiroshiki-Yonin (Daimyo's wife's steward or, key steward in a merchant household).
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除し、クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: しかし、広義の用人にはこれらの全てが含まれるが、ここでは主に狭義の用人の意味について解説する。
sen.e: However, in a broader sense, the role of `Yojin` included all the above roles however, in this text the `Yojin` meaning is interpreted in a narrow sense.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, in a broader sense, the role of `Yojin` included all the above roles however, in this text the `Yojin` meaning is interpreted in a narrow sense.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, in a broader sense, the role of Yonin included all the above roles however, in this text the Yonin meaning is interpreted in a narrow sense.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 用人は、主君の用向きを伝えることを主たる役目とする。
sen.e: The `Yojin` (steward) role was mainly responsible for taking care of the lord's affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The `Yojin` (steward) role was mainly responsible for taking care of the lord's affairs.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Yonin role was mainly responsible for taking care of the lord's affairs.

sen.j: しかし、側用人が設置されている諸藩・大身旗本にあった。
sen.e: However, the role `Soba-Yonin` (adjutant steward) refers to the individual mainly responsible for dealing with a lord's domain and senior vassals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the role `Soba-Yonin` (adjutant steward) refers to the individual mainly responsible for dealing with a lord's domain and senior vassals.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, the role Soba-Yonin refers to the individual mainly responsible for dealing with a lord's domain and senior vassals.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変え、前出補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 側用人は、主君の「私事・家政の用向き」を伝え、相手方と折衝して庶務を司ることを主な役目とする。
sen.e: The `Soba-Yonin` is said to have mainly handled the lord's general business including: private and political affairs and, dealings with others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 一方の用人は、主君の「公的な用向き」を藩内・家中に伝えて、相手方と折衝して庶務を司るとを役目とする。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Yojin was mainly responsible for keeping the lord informed of `official matters` within the domain and family and, handling general negotiations and dealings with other parties.

sen.j: 藩主の公的な用向きを藩内・家中に伝えるのが公用人ではないので、注意が必要である。

sen.j: 江戸時代初期には、用人職を設置しなかった藩も珍しくなかった。
sen.e: At the beginning of the Edo period, it was not unusual for domains not to have an established Yojin (steward) role.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: At the beginning of the Edo period, it was not unusual for domains not to have an established Yojin (steward) role.

sen.e: At the beginning of the Edo period, it was not unusual for domains not to have an established Yonin role.

sen.j: しかし、泰平の世となり、いわば事務屋・連絡役・折衝役としての性格を持つ用人は、ほぼ全国諸藩に設置されるようになった。
sen.e: However, with the coming of peace, Yojin that were responsible for office clerical and related roles were appeared in place in various provinces across Japan.

sen.j: 大きな藩では、用人の地位は重臣とは言えず、藩主・老職などの公的な用向きを関係方面に伝えて、折衝して庶務を司ることを役目とする。
sen.e: In larger domains, the role of Yojin (steward) could not be said to be `chief retainer` but, was a role that handled business, dealing and general affairs for the lord and elders of the domain.

sen.j: 小さな藩では、用人は家老に次ぐ重臣であって、家老の職務を全般を補佐していることが多い。
sen.e: In the smaller domains, the Yojin (steward) was second to the elders as chief retainers and, it was common to provide the elders with a whole range of assistance.

sen.j: 時には用人身分のままで加判の列に加わることもあった。
sen.e: At times, there were occasions when the Yojin (steward) made their own decisions.

sen.j: 用人の地位は、全国諸藩においてまちまちであるが、大雑把に云って、大藩であるほど上級家臣の中でその地位は相対的に高くなく、小藩であるほどその地位は相対的に高い傾向があることは疑いがない。
sen.e: The status of Yojin (steward) differed between the various provinces in Japan however, generally speaking, in the larger domains the Yojin's status was not higher than the senior retainers and, there is no doubt that the smaller the domains there was a tendency for the Yojin's status to be relatively higher.

sen.j: 諸藩の用人は、いずれも馬上を許された上級家臣である。

sen.e: Also, in many provinces where the Yojin worked as highly paid senior vassals, those vassals engaged retainers themselves to act as their own Yojin.

sen.e: However with the exception of the high ranking families and alternative arrangements, as a general rule as vassals of the Edo Bakufu (Shogunate), Yojin (stewards) were not provided for family elders and the elderly within families.
